document.docAuthor: Bakker, Piet A. J. & Albano, Paolo G.
document.masterDocTitle: Nomenclator, geographic and stratigraphic distribution of the family Triphoridae (Mollusca: Gastropoda)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Nomenclator, geographic and stratigraphic distribution of the family Triphoridae (Mollusca: Gastropoda)

bibRefCitation.author: Rolan, E. & Cruz-Abrego, F. M.
bibRefCitation.refString: Rolan, E. & Cruz-Abrego, F. M. (1995) A new Triphorid species (Gastropoda, Triphoridae) from Nichupte lagoon, Yucatan Peninsula, Mexico. Iberus, 13 (2), 87 - 92.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. MNCM 15.05/18726, holotype .
ZMA .MOLL.136639, MNHN-IM-2000-382 and NHMUK 1996045 , paratypes
.

Remarks. The records from Florida, United States , are a misidentification of
Triphora calva Faber & Moolenbeek, 1991
(M.R. Fernandes, pers. com. January 2020 ).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cerithium nigrocinctum C.B. Adams, 1850: 286
, pl. 4, fig. 11.

Triforis perversa var. nigrocincta (C.B. Adams, 1839 )
—
Dall 1889a: 243
.

Marshallora nigrocincta (C.B. Adams, 1839 )
—
Rolán & Fernández-Garcés 1995: 10
, fig. 5–7.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality.
United States , Massachusetts , Darthmouth harbor
.

Remarks. Lectotype designated by Clench & Turner (1950) . The report of this species from Italy by Grillo (1877) is a misidentification. The name
Cerithium nigrocinctum
hides a complex of species, and its true range is limited to southeastern Canada to the southern U.S.A. (M.R. Fernandes, pers. com. January 2020 ). The record from Florida, United States , by Lee (2009) is a misidentfication of
Triphoris dupliniana Olsson, 1916
( Fernandes & Pimenta 2020 ).
